ai.summary: A short, easy 1.5 km stroll in the UK that combines historic mills, a fishing spot, and a serpentine riverside path. Suitable for most walkers, families, and dogs on leads, with tranquil scenery and gentle elevation changes.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly flat, with hard-packed paths along a riverside towpath and a serpentine loop. Surfaces include gravel, compact dirt, and some grassy edges. Muddy patches possible after rain; expect occasional bridges or boardwalk sections near the water.
ai.safety_notes: Watch for water edges and fishing activity. UK weather can change quickly—bring a layer and protection against rain. Paths can be busy; keep to the right and supervise children and dogs. Be cautious of uneven surfaces and avoid the route during flood warnings or high water.
recommended_gear: Comfortable walking shoes or lightweight boots
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) offer the best conditions and daylight; route is walkable year-round, but winter can bring mud and low visibility.

seo.title: Mills, fishing and serpentine walk - Easy 1.5 km UK hike
seo.meta_description: Explore an easy 1.5 km hike in the UK featuring historic mills, a fishing spot, and a serpentine riverside path. Ideal for a gentle day out with family or friends.
seo.h1: Mills, fishing and serpentine walk – Easy 1.5 km UK hike
